meanings.definition: Make or become rough or harsh in texture or tone.
meanings.sent1: The constant rubbing of the sandpaper was coarsening the surface of the wood.
meanings.sent2: Over time, the fabric started coarsening due to repeated washing.
meanings.sent3: The chef's attempt to coarsen the sauce by adding too much salt left everyone with a bitter taste in their mouths.
meanings.sent4: The once smooth relationship between the neighbors was coarsening, turning into a series of arguments and disagreements.
meanings.sent5: The artist used bold brushstrokes to coarsen the texture of the painting, creating a striking effect.

meanings.definition: Make or become less refined or cultured.
meanings.sent1: The exposure to the harsh realities of life was slowly coarsening her outlook on the world.
meanings.sent2: As time passed, the refined manners of the aristocrat began to coarsen, much to the dismay of their peers.
meanings.sent3: The attempt to coarsen the elegant dinner party by serving fast food was met with raised eyebrows from the guests.
meanings.sent4: The once sophisticated language of the poet started to coarsen, reflecting a shift in societal norms.
meanings.sent5: The decision to coarsen the fine silk fabric with rough stitching resulted in a unique and edgy fashion statement.
